name: Ireland
description: Ireland, known as the Emerald Isle, is an island nation in northwest Europe, famed for its dramatic coastline, rolling green hills, ancient history, and vibrant culture.  It’s a land of contrasts, boasting rugged Atlantic cliffs, serene lakes, and bustling cities.  Ireland’s unique blend of Celtic heritage, British influence, and modern innovation creates a captivating experience for visitors.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Ireland has a relatively small but densely populated population.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in urban areas, particularly Dublin and Cork.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Ireland is a compact island nation.
quickFacts.detail: It’s roughly the size of Costa Rica.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Dublin is the heart of Ireland's political, economic, and cultural life.
quickFacts.detail: It’s a vibrant city with a rich literary and musical heritage.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Both languages are widely spoken and used in daily life.
quickFacts.detail: Irish (Gaeilge) is a Celtic language with a long and complex history.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: Ireland uses the Euro as its currency.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.detail: It's a major hub for technology and pharmaceuticals.

climateData.title: Temperate Oceanic Climate
climateData.description: Ireland experiences a temperate oceanic climate, characterized by mild, wet winters and cool summers. Rainfall is abundant throughout the year, contributing to the island's lush greenery.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming and an explosion of wildflowers across the countryside.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is generally mild and wet, with average temperatures around 15-20°C (59-68°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings cooler temperatures and increased rainfall, with stunning autumn foliage in many areas.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is cool and wet, with average temperatures around 5-10°C (41-50°F). Snowfall is relatively rare, but can occur.

naturalWonders.name: Giant's Causeway
naturalWonders.description: The Giant's Causeway is a dramatic coastal rock formation consisting of approximately 40,000 interlocking basalt columns. Legend has it that it was formed by a giant falling into the sea.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Formed by a volcanic fissure eruption approximately 60 million years ago, the Causeway is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a testament to the power of nature. The hexagonal columns are a result of the cooling and contraction of the lava.

naturalWonders.name: Cliffs of Moher
naturalWonders.description: The Cliffs of Moher are a spectacular stretch of rugged coastline in County Clare, offering breathtaking views of the Atlantic Ocean.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Rising to a height of 214 meters (702 feet), the cliffs provide a dramatic backdrop to the surrounding landscape. They are home to a diverse range of seabirds, including puffins, guillemots, and razorbills.
bestLocations: The Cliffs of Moher Visitor Centre

naturalWonders.name: Wicklow Mountains National Park
naturalWonders.description: The Wicklow Mountains National Park is a beautiful area of mountains, lakes, and woodlands in County Wicklow.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Known as the 'Garden of Ireland', the Wicklow Mountains offer stunning scenery and a wealth of outdoor activities. Glendalough, a glacial valley with a historic monastic site, is a highlight of the park.

biodiversityCategory.name: Coastal Birds
biodiversityCategory.description: Ireland’s coastline is a vital habitat for a wide variety of seabirds, attracted by the abundant fish and sheltered waters.

statistics.details: The largest puffin colony in Ireland is located on the Skellig Islands.
These seabirds nest in large colonies along the cliffs.

notableSpecies.name: Puffin
notableSpecies.significance: A beloved symbol of Ireland, known for its brightly colored beak.

notableSpecies.name: Guillemot
notableSpecies.significance: A common seabird that plays a crucial role in the marine ecosystem.

ecosystemData.title: Atlantic Oak Woodland
ecosystemData.overview: Atlantic Oak Woodland is a unique and fragile ecosystem found primarily in the west of Ireland. It’s characterized by a mix of oak trees, hawthorn, and other native species, adapted to the cool, wet climate.

biodiversityCategories.name: Native Trees
biodiversityCategories.description: The dominant tree species in Atlantic Oak Woodland.

statistics.details: Specifically, sessile oak and sessile ash are prevalent.

notableSpecies.name: Sessile Oak
notableSpecies.significance: A key component of the woodland ecosystem.

activities.title: Outdoor Adventures in Ireland
activities.description: Ireland offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from gentle hikes to challenging climbs.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Ireland’s stunning landscapes on foot.

activities.name: The Twelve Bens Hike
activities.description: A challenging multi-day hike through the Twelve Bens mountain range in County Galway.
activities.requirements: Good fitness level, hiking boots, waterproof clothing

activities.name: Connor Pass Hike
activities.description: A scenic hike across Connor Pass, the highest mountain pass in County Kerry.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Atlantic Ocean with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Ireland has a growing surfing scene, with popular spots along the west coast.

activities.name: Sea Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the coastline by kayak, discovering hidden coves and sea caves.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket and trousers, hat, gloves

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, first-aid kit
